messages.message: For Deployment data retention, I do not see the default value for the number of days for existing Deployments. CC: @tony.shi
Are you editing an existing deployment or creating a new one here?

Checking now; Was this deployment originally created without deployment retention settings by any chance? (i.e. was it created before we offered the deployment retention feature)

Off the top of my head, I believe that would cause a null value to be in our db. We have front end validation to force the user to specify a default value
ya it was created without deployment retention settings
i was turning it on and saw that there was no default value
its not high priority, but we should at least have the default value there and have that be consistent across Deployments

Understood. Can I clarify the workflow for this?

1. The user creates a deployment without retention settings
2. The user edits the retention setting
    a. When the user turns on the enable automatic run cleanup toggle, the box specifying # of days goes to 90 if no value is found in our DB
    b. The user can then chose to change/keep this value
2a just isnt happening rn, but i believe it only doesn't happen for existing Deployments
